before_session_1.summary: Brooke Davis starts experiencing intense anxiety about going back to the animal shelter after a few animals don't greet her as warmly as they used to. Despite her love for animals, this leads to feelings of guilt and a sense of rejection. Over the past few months, she begins to avoid the shelter altogether and feels her passion for working with animals slipping away. Tired and stressed, Brooke finds herself struggling with sleep and feeling increasingly isolated as she distances herself from fellow volunteers.

events.title: Cold reception at the shelter
events.description: After returning to the shelter after a break, Brooke is met with indifference from some animals who used to react fondly to her presence. This brings her immediate feelings of guilt and self-blame for not being as impactful in their lives.
dominant_thoughts: They must hate me for not remembering them.

events.title: Internalizing emotions
events.description: Brooke spends unnecessary time ruminating about how her feelings might affect the animals she cares for, leading to sleepless nights and excessive worry.
dominant_thoughts: I should have done more for them.
I am not a good person.

events.title: Starting to avoid social gatherings
events.description: Brooke declines invitations to social events with friends, explaining her busy schedule. However, her real reason is her anxiety about interacting in social settings, stemming from fear of judgment.
dominant_thoughts: They won't understand what I'm going through.

between_sessions_1_2.summary: In the week following her decision to make a change, Brooke's anxiety about the shelter continues. She tries to write down her feelings, but it brings up overwhelming emotions. At work, she struggles to focus as her thoughts drift to the animals and feelings of guilt surface. A fight with a friend over an unrelated issue exacerbates her feelings of isolation and self-blame, making her reconsider whether to reach out for help.

events.title: Journaling exercise
events.description: Brooke attempts to journal her thoughts and feelings. While writing, she becomes flooded with memories of the animals' previous affection, intensifying her guilt about not going back.
dominant_thoughts: This just proves I'm a failure.

events.title: Difficulty concentrating at work
events.description: At her job as a veterinary assistant, Brooke finds it hard to focus on tasks with her mind constantly drifting back to the shelter. This results in mistakes and feeling increasingly incompetent.
dominant_thoughts: I'm going to mess everything up.

events.title: Conflict with a friend
events.description: Brooke gets into a disagreement with a close friend over the friend's insistence on planning a group trip. She feels misunderstood and judged, exacerbating her inner turmoil and sense of isolation.
dominant_thoughts: My friends don't care about my feelings.
I must be a burden to them.

between_sessions_2_3.summary: Brooke finds herself grappling with her self-worth as she tries to attend the shelter but feels frozen with anxiety. She decides to venture out with a friend for the first time in weeks but ends up feeling judged by others. At work, she surprisingly gets praised for her dedication to a project, but she discounts this positive feedback. Her feelings of guilt resurface with a friend mentioning visiting a different shelter.

events.title: Attempt to visit the shelter
events.description: In a moment of courage, Brooke tries to visit the animal shelter. Upon arrival, she cannot bring herself to step inside and feels like a failure, fleeing back to her car.
dominant_thoughts: It's too much; they will hate me.

events.title: Feeling judged at social event
events.description: Brooke accompanies a friend to a small gathering but feels scrutinized. The anxiety deepens when she tries to join conversations but struggles to find her voice.

events.title: Discounting positive feedback at work
events.description: Brooke receives recognition for her hard work on a project, but instead of acknowledging it, she brushes it aside, feeling undeserving of praise.
dominant_thoughts: They just feel sorry for me.

between_sessions_3_4.summary: Brooke takes a small step by volunteering to care for animals at a different shelter, where she feels nervous but somewhat encouraged. Conversations with supportive friends help reassure her, though she still struggles with guilt about not returning to her usual shelter. A friend's pet becomes ill, and Brooke steps up to help, reigniting her passion for animal care but also bringing back anxiety about her ability to cope.

events.title: Volunteering at a different shelter
events.description: Brooke decides to volunteer at another local shelter for a day. She feels nervous but manages to connect with a few animals, which sparks some hope in her.
dominant_thoughts: Maybe I can still enjoy being with animals.
I hope they won't become indifferent too.

events.title: Friend's pet needs care
events.description: When a friend's pet falls ill, Brooke steps in to help with the care. While fulfilling and reigniting her passion, it also creates anxiety about how to cope with the situation.

events.title: Conversations about fears
events.description: Brooke has a heart-to-heart with a supportive friend about her fears related to the shelter. This leads to some reassurance but also brings up additional feelings of guilt.
dominant_thoughts: I wish I didn't feel this way.

between_sessions_4_5.summary: After returning from volunteering, Brooke feels inspired but still apprehensive. She begins experimenting with breathing exercises to manage her anxiety. An unexpected car trouble leads to a stressful week, exacerbating her feelings of inadequacy when she can't afford immediate repairs. Conversations with colleagues lead to some learning opportunities, and she thinks increasingly about visiting the shelter again, but doubts linger.

events.title: Practicing breathing exercises
events.description: In an attempt to manage her anxiety better, Brooke starts using breathing techniques she heard about. She notices a slight improvement in her mood but the temptation to avoid the shelter remains.
dominant_thoughts: This might help me feel better.

events.title: Car trouble stress
events.description: Brooke experiences unexpected car trouble that prevents her from commuting as usual. She feels overwhelmed when she realizes she cannot afford the necessary repairs, further intensifying her feelings of helplessness.

events.title: Learning opportunities at work
events.description: Brooke participates in a training at work that revolves around animal care. While engaged, she feels a sense of purpose and optimism for her profession, despite her ongoing fears.

between_sessions_5_6.summary: Brooke feels a surge of motivation after her training and begins to think more positively about her future with animals. She takes another small step to reach out to the shelter and schedule a visit, though anxiety looms. Despite a busy week at work, she manages to squeeze in time to care for her friend’s pet again, deepening her connection with animals and her resilience.

events.title: Scheduling a visit to the shelter
events.description: In a bold move, Brooke reaches out to the shelter to schedule a visit. While a wave of anxiety follows, she feels proud of taking this step.
dominant_thoughts: What if they don't remember me?
behaviors: felt a mix of anxiety and pride

events.title: Helping care for friend's pet again
events.description: Brooke helps her friend with their pet's ongoing care. This time, she feels more confident in her abilities and enjoys the process.

events.title: Busy work week
events.description: Despite the pressure at work, Brooke manages to keep her focus. She meets with colleagues to discuss ongoing projects, which helps her feel more connected and valued.

between_sessions_6_7.summary: Brooke experiences a mix of excitement and anxiety about her upcoming shelter visit. The day arrives, and nerves almost cripple her, but she employs her breathing exercises to manage the panic. The visit proves to be a sweet surprise as many animals greet her warmly, lifting her spirits. She also faces a stressful confrontation with a neighbor about pet noise, reigniting her self-doubt despite positive experiences at the shelter.

events.title: Shelter visit
events.description: Brooke finally visits the shelter. She employs breathing exercises to cope with anxiety and is pleasantly surprised by the warm reception from many animals, which alleviates some of her fears.
dominant_thoughts: Maybe I can do this more often.

events.title: Confrontation with a neighbor
events.description: After her uplifting shelter visit, Brooke has a disagreement with a neighbor regarding their pets causing noise. This confrontation drains her emotionally and amplifies her feelings of inadequacy.

events.title: Celebrating shelter visit success
events.description: After her positive experience at the shelter, Brooke shares her exciting news with friends, feeling a sense of pride for overcoming her fear.

between_sessions_7_8.summary: Brooke's newfound confidence leads her to set a regular volunteering schedule at the shelter. She faces mild setbacks with her neighbor and feels the pressure of work. Despite these, conversations with her supportive friends keep her motivated. She starts noticing how her thoughts are less harsh and critical, leading to more realistic self-assessments.

events.title: Setting a regular shelter schedule
events.description: Inspired by her recent success, Brooke establishes a routine volunteering schedule at the shelter, excited to reconnect with the animals.

events.title: Ongoing neighbor issues
events.description: The conflicts with her neighbor continue, leading to increased frustration. However, Brooke manages to talk to her friend to alleviate some frustration instead of internalizing it, noticing this as a positive change.
dominant_thoughts: I can handle this better now.

events.title: Reflecting positively at work
events.description: Brooke assesses her performance at work and notices she's doing well, leading to more realistic interpretations of her contributions, thanks to supportive feedback from supervisors.

between_sessions_8_9.summary: Brooke celebrates her commitment to the shelter and reflects on her journey. Though she encounters rough days, her ability to manage anxiety improves, with coping strategies becoming more accessible. Support from friends has been valuable, and even when arriving late to work, she recognizes that it's okay to be imperfect. Despite residual fears, she feels equipped to navigate challenges.

events.title: Reflecting on personal growth
events.description: Brooke takes time to write about her experiences and acknowledges her progress, which strengthens her resolve to keep moving forward with her anxiety about the shelter.

events.title: Late arrival at work
events.description: Brooke arrives late to work due to traffic but manages to remain calm, telling herself it’s okay to be imperfect and that she can make up for the time later.

events.title: Excited for upcoming volunteering
events.description: Brooke feels enthusiastic about her next scheduled volunteering day at the shelter and looks forward to reconnecting with the animals.
dominant_thoughts: I can't wait to go back.
They'll be happy to see me.

global_trajectory.cognitive_change: Brooke's cognitive patterns show gradual shifts from negative and rigid thought processes to more balanced and flexible thinking. She begins to recognize her skills and contributions instead of automatically dismissing them. As she engages in self-reflection, she replaces catastrophic thoughts with hope.
global_trajectory.emotional_change: Over time, Brooke experiences a significant reduction in anxiety and fear, transitioning from overwhelming feelings of guilt to manageable emotions. She finds joy in her interactions with animals and anticipates future visits with excitement.
global_trajectory.behavioral_change: Behaviorally, Brooke moves from complete avoidance of the shelter to actively scheduling and committing to volunteer opportunities. She engages more with friends and communicates her feelings instead of retreating into avoidance, establishing healthier coping mechanisms.
